text: Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd. saw profit decline in the three months ended March, missing analyst estimates.Net profit in the fourth quarter fell 57 percent to Rs 215.6 crore compared to that a year ago, according to its stock exchange filing. Analysts tracked by Bloomberg had estimated a profit of Rs 596 crore.Revenue declined 2.2 percent over last year to Rs 9,874.4 crore. The topline too missed the Bloomberg consensus estimate of Rs 11,176.5 crore.Operating income stood at Rs 651 crore, a decline of 25 percent from the same quarter last year. Operating margins contracted 190 basis points to 6.7 percent.Other income, that is, income apart from operations fell 68.5 percent to Rs 145.2 crore compared to the same quarter last year.BHEL had an outstanding order book of Rs 1,05,200 crore at the end of financial year 2016-17.
title: BHEL Misses Estimates As Profit Falls
